original_title: Intrepid expands Sri Lanka adventure tours
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Australia-based Intrepid is expanding its adventure tours to Sri Lanka as tourism in the Indian Ocean island recovers after an economic crisis, a Chief Executive of the firm, James Thornton said.

“The number of adventure traveller’s Intrepid hopes to help reach Sri Lanka this year is expected to increase from the 3,500 who visited there in 2019, before the outbreak, to 5,000,” Thornton said in Colombo.

Though Sri Lanka has not recovered as quickly as some of the other locations as the result of the island’s latest currency crisis, the worst in the history of its intermediate regime central bank, more tourists were returning to Sri Lanka.
“We are optimistic about the second part of the year for the Sri Lankan market.”

Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) Chairman Priantha Fernando, Sri Lanka has raised its tourist arrival target to 2.0 million in 2023 from an earlier 1.5 million on the back of better trends seen in the first quarter, which is 323,185 tourists by March 28.
Sri Lanka is “clustered with mountains, stunning beaches, excellent iconic cultural attractions, diverse kind of history, amazing food, and people,” Thornton said.
“Any of those are qualities an adventure traveller seeks in a top adventure travel destination,” he said.
Sri Lanka could also position itself as a “sustainability leader” such as by cutting down single use plastic .
As an adventure tourism firm intrepid found some of the roads in Sri Lanka can be improved, Thornton said. Intrepid offers tour packages up to two weeks in Sri Lanka.
Intrepid, the Center of Excellence also provides services in Sri Lanka, including technology, engineering, finance, human resources and customer service.
“Currently, we have 200 people working here now and this office is our biggest office in the world,” Thornton said.

“Intrepid intends to introduce a new paid graduate internship program in 2023 as part of its continued commitment to Sri Lanka. Fifteen alumni will be observed by The Intrepid Colombo Future Leaders program and will spend six months working in variety of departments.”
Intrepid plans to hire 30 more staff to its Sri Lanka centre in 2023. (Colombo/Apr28/2023)
